page.title: 10HISTORICAL INTEREST
page.content: The Church of St.James dates from early Norman times-mentioned in a charter of 1204. Inside- Norman Font bowl. Arch and Tympanum of original Norman doorway 14th Centuryhagioscope or 'squint' Outside -Coped gravestone with ritual shears of an Archdeacon Broken cross of white sandstone. Underground-a sandstone 'kist' containing several doubled up skeletons. Ancient things found near the Church 1689-Brass and pewter found and taken to Appleby Castle(Now unknown) 1823- The famous Ormside Cup (7th century)found in the churchyard, and taken to York Museum. 1898-Found- a Danish sword and the umbo of a shield.
